dcterms:description: A corpus of Chinese linguistic minimal pairs (MPs) designed to evaluate Chinese language models (LMs). CLiMP consists of sets of 1,000 minimal pairs for 16 syntactic contrasts in Mandarin, covering 9 major Mandarin linguistic phenomena. The MPs are semi-automatically generated, and human agreement with the labels in CLiMP is 95.8%.
dcterms:title: CLiMP (Chinese Linguistic Minimal Pairs)

dcterms:creator: Alex Warstadt
Alicia Parrish
Haokun Liu
Anhad Monananey
Wei Peng
Sheng-Fu Wang
Samuel Bowman
dcterms:description: A benchmark of linguistic minimal pairs for English, consisting of 67 datasets, each containing 1,000 minimal pairs organized by phenomenon into 12 categories.
dcterms:title: BLiMP (Benchmark of Linguistic Minimal Pairs for English)

dcterms:description: A source of word frequency data used for linguistic analysis, specifically mentioned in relation to the vocabulary used in CLiMP.
dcterms:title: Chinese Internet Corpus

dcterms:description: Various datasets used for training LSTM and 5-gram models, referenced in the context of model evaluation but not specified as individual datasets.
dcterms:title: Various datasets for LSTM and 5-gram models
